\/.title: Home
\/.teaser_markdown: Tours of the VOA radio and television studios in Washington are available to the public. It's a fascinating look at the largest U.S. international broadcast operation.
\/.teaser_html: Tours of the VOA radio and television studios in Washington are available to the public. It's a fascinating look at the largest U.S. international broadcast operation.

content.markdown:
## [About the Tour](/about/)

The Voice of America Studio Tour is a behind-the-scenes look at live broadcasting in radio, television, and the Internet in several of our 45 languages. Tours last 45 minutes.
content.html:
About the Tour

The Voice of America Studio Tour is a behind-the-scenes look at live broadcasting in radio, television, and the Internet in several of our 45 languages. Tours last 45 minutes.

content.markdown:
## [What you need to bring](/bring/)

You will need to present a valid US federal or state-issued picture ID, such as a driver's license, passport or state-issued ID. A non-US citizen is required to provide their passport. The building guards cannot accept other documents or waive these requirements.
content.html:
What you need to bring

You will need to present a valid US federal or state-issued picture ID, such as a driver's license, passport or state-issued ID. A non-US citizen is required to provide their passport. The building guards cannot accept other documents or waive these requirements.

content.markdown: ## [Address & Directions](/directions/) VOA is located at 330 Independence Avenue, S.W., Washington, D.C. 20237. It is easily accessible by car, bus, and metro. View details »
content.html:
Address & Directions

VOA is located at 330 Independence Avenue, S.W., Washington, D.C. 20237. It is easily accessible by car, bus, and metro.

View details »

\/about\/.title: About the Tour
\/about\/.teaser_markdown: Tours of the VOA radio and television studios in Washington are available to the public. It's a fascinating look at the largest U.S. international broadcast operation.
\/about\/.teaser_html: Tours of the VOA radio and television studios in Washington are available to the public. It's a fascinating look at the largest U.S. international broadcast operation.

content.markdown:
The Voice of America Studio Tour offers a firsthand look at VOA’s live news and information programming that is broadcast to an international audience in 45 languages on radio, television, and the Internet.

### Daily Tours

* Daily public tours are offered Monday through Friday at 12:00 p.m. (except Federal holidays). The doors open 10 minutes before the scheduled tour time.
* Admission: Free
* Each tour lasts 30-40 minutes.
* The tour is conducted in English only.
* Tour is recommended for children age 16 and above.

### Commercial Tour Companies

To find out how to include VOA in your tour route, please email [publicrelations@voanews.com](mailto:publicrelations@voanews.com).

### Reservations

* For groups of 5 or more visitors, we ask that you please email [publicrelations@voanews.com](mailto:publicrelations@voanews.com). Groups are limited to 20 visitors.
* Reservations are recommended and can be made online.
* While walk-ins are accepted, we recommend that you call ahead or check the reservation system online, since public tours may occasionally be closed for private groups or special events being held in the building.
* When making a reservation, please indicate if a wheelchair or any other assistance is needed.

### Historic Murals

VOA’s headquarters is home to a series of historic murals commissioned by the U.S. government to depict the Social Security Act and other New Deal programs enacted in response to the Great Depression. Lithuanian-born artist Ben Shahn was selected in 1940 to paint the most prominent of the murals. Those wishing to view the murals should specify when contacting VOA to make special arrangements.

The Voice of America Studio Tour offers a firsthand look at VOA’s live news and information programming that is broadcast to an international audience in 45 languages on radio, television, and the Internet.

Daily Tours

  • Daily public tours are offered Monday through Friday at 12:00 p.m. (except Federal holidays). The doors open 10 minutes before the scheduled tour time.
  • Admission: Free
  • Each tour lasts 30-40 minutes.
  • The tour is conducted in English only.
  • Tour is recommended for children age 16 and above.

Commercial Tour Companies

To find out how to include VOA in your tour route, please email publicrelations@voanews.com.

Reservations

  • For groups of 5 or more visitors, we ask that you please email publicrelations@voanews.com. Groups are limited to 20 visitors.
  • Reservations are recommended and can be made online.
  • While walk-ins are accepted, we recommend that you call ahead or check the reservation system online, since public tours may occasionally be closed for private groups or special events being held in the building.
  • When making a reservation, please indicate if a wheelchair or any other assistance is needed.

Historic Murals

VOA’s headquarters is home to a series of historic murals commissioned by the U.S. government to depict the Social Security Act and other New Deal programs enacted in response to the Great Depression. Lithuanian-born artist Ben Shahn was selected in 1940 to paint the most prominent of the murals. Those wishing to view the murals should specify when contacting VOA to make special arrangements.

content.markdown: ### Where We Are 330 Independence Ave., S.W.\ Washington, D.C. 20237 ### Where to Enter Please enter the building through the entrance on C Street. C Street is on the opposite side of the building from Independence Avenue between 3rd and 4th Streets. Tours begin in the lobby of the C Street entrance. ### Where to Park Public lots are located nearby. ### Closest Metrorail Stations #### Federal Center Southwest Station (**Blue**, **Orange** & **Silver** lines) * Exit onto 3rd Street, turn left and walk one block along 3rd Street to the corner of 3rd and C Streets. * Cross C Street to the building with the parking lot in front; turn left. * VOA's entrance is in the middle of the block, between 3rd and 4th Streets. #### L'Enfant Plaza Station (**Yellow**, **Green**, **Blue**, **Orange** & **Silver** lines) * Take the 7th Street/Maryland Ave. exit and walk east to the corner of 4th Street and Independence Avenue. * Cross 4th Street and turn right and walk one block to the corner of 4th and C Streets. * Turn left and walk down C Street toward 3rd Street. * VOA’s entrance is in the middle of the block between 3rd and 4th Streets.
content.html:
Where We Are

330 Independence Ave., S.W.
Washington, D.C. 20237

Where to Enter

Please enter the building through the entrance on C Street. C Street is on the opposite side of the building from Independence Avenue between 3rd and 4th Streets. Tours begin in the lobby of the C Street entrance.

Where to Park

Public lots are located nearby.

Closest Metrorail Stations

Federal Center Southwest Station

(Blue, Orange & Silver lines)

  • Exit onto 3rd Street, turn left and walk one block along 3rd Street to the corner of 3rd and C Streets.
  • Cross C Street to the building with the parking lot in front; turn left.
  • VOA's entrance is in the middle of the block, between 3rd and 4th Streets.

L'Enfant Plaza Station

(Yellow, Green, Blue, Orange & Silver lines)

  • Take the 7th Street/Maryland Ave. exit and walk east to the corner of 4th Street and Independence Avenue.
  • Cross 4th Street and turn right and walk one block to the corner of 4th and C Streets.
  • Turn left and walk down C Street toward 3rd Street.
  • VOA’s entrance is in the middle of the block between 3rd and 4th Streets.
